name: N,N-dibenzylhydroxylamine
Reason: 1,2-propanediol, 3-(2-methoxyphenoxy)-, 1-carbam has a melting point of 92 degrees Celsius. The basic unit we can compare to is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in N,N-dibenzylhydroxylamine will affect its melting point: (1) Two phenyl groups, which could each add approximately +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure; (2) The methoxy group introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, raising the melting point by approximately +5 degrees Celsius. The hydroxylamine group introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, which can further contribute to the melting point, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The presence of two additional phenyl groups can significantly increase the melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C.
